reviews.comment: I can see my house from here
Why are we still here? Just to SUFFER?

products.name: The Sun
products.description: At this center of our solar system, it's *quite* hot. We accept no liability for any damage to your eyes when looking at this stellar object.

reviews.comment: It's FAR too HOT. But it does look nice.

reviews.author: admin@shop.com
reviews.comment: Got a nice tan from this. Worth every penny!

products.name: The Moon
products.description: It's the Moon, a very original name don't you think.

reviews.author: user@shop.com
reviews.comment: You can get a really good view of Earth from here, really gives you a sense of scale.
No one told me there was no atmosphere here! Atleast I get a good view while I'm dying writing this review.

products.name: Mercury
products.description:
Being the closest planet to the sun, mercury is a very extreme planet (and a horrible place to live).
It's surface temperature ranges from -173C at night to 427C during the day.
A day on mercury is also longer than it's year at 176 days.
Mercury is also the second most dense planet in the solar system, only being exceeded by Earth.

products.name: Venus
products.description: Venus is the hottest planet in the solar system, it's very dense atmosphere causes a run-away greenhouse effect, resulting in surface temperatures of 462 degrees C. It is very similar in mass to Earth, and is sometimes referred to as its 'sister' planet. The atmospheric pressure on venus is 92 times that of Earths. It's close proximity to Earth made it a prime first exploration target, and it was the first planet beyond Earth to be visited by a spacecraft (Mariner 2 in 1962), and the first to be successfully landed on (Venera 7 in 1970).

products.name: Mars
products.description: Mars is the 4th of the 4 inner terrestrial planets. It has a very thin atmosphere (less than 1% of Earths) mostly made of COâ‚‚, mars as been explored by many unmanned spacecraft (of which Mariner 4 was the first, launched in 1964). There are ongoing investigations into the past habitability of mars, liquid water may not be present on the surface, but mars has ice caps which hold large reserves of water. This could make it an ideal planet for human exploration. Mars is also home to the tallest planetary mountain in the solar system (Olympus Mons). Mars has days which are only slightly logner than Earths.

reviews.author: test@test.com
reviews.comment: Very nice except for the sub par atmosphere.

products.name: Phobos
products.description: The larger of the two martian moons.

products.name: Jupiter
products.description: Larger than all of the other planets in the solar system combined, Jupiter is huge, but it is still only 1/1000 of the suns mass. Jupiter has 79 known moons, 4 of which are the well known Galilean moons (Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto).
